txt:
A: 彼は野球が上手だよ。
A: He plays baseball very well.
B: すごいね、彼は勉強も得意らしいよ。
B: Wow, he (　　　) to be good at studying too.
correctText: wow, he seems to be good at studying too.

msg: wow, he seem to be good at studing too.
I saw him at the park near the station yesterday.
txt:
A: 僕は昨日、駅近くの公園で彼を見かけたよ。
A: I saw him at the park near the station yesterday.
B: 本当？彼はさっき、直接家に帰ったって言ってたわよ。
B: Really? He (　　　) that he went home directly just now.
correctText: Really? He said that he went home directly just now.

msg: really? he says that he went home directly just now.
is this table make of wood?
txt:
A: このテーブルは木でできているの？
A: Is this table (　　　) of wood?
B: そうだよ、だけどこの椅子は鉄でできているんだ。
B: Yes, but this chair is made of iron.
correctText: Yes, but this chair is made of iron.

msg: yes, but this chair is made of iron.
correctText: is this table made of wood?

msg: can you help me after school?
txt:
A: 学校が終わったら、手を貸してもらってもいいかな？
A: Can you help me after school?
B: もちろん、ただその前にこの宿題を出しに行かないと。
B: Of course, but I (　　　) hand in this homework before that.
correctText: Of course, but I must hand in this homework before that.

msg: Of course, but I may hand in this homework before that.
